content.raw:
As of now, pressing enter is equivalent to pressing Ok and closes the inspectors, which I think makes sense. Esc is equivalent to Cancel. 

I think a hotkey for `Apply` would be useful, because it keep trying to make small changes on the inspectors and checking the result. 

Actually, all 3 buttons have a letter underlined, which I assumed meant that pressing the letter would press the button, but nothing seems to happen when I press `C`, `A` or `O`.

![inspector1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/44215876-inspector1.png)
content.html:
As of now, pressing enter is equivalent to pressing Ok and closes the inspectors, which I think makes sense. Esc is equivalent to Cancel.

I think a hotkey for Apply would be useful, because it keep trying to make small changes on the inspectors and checking the result.

Actually, all 3 buttons have a letter underlined, which I assumed meant that pressing the letter would press the button, but nothing seems to happen when I press C, A or O.

content.raw:
I removed the underlines. 

@spaepcke Do you know what's hotkey is commonly used for `Apply`?
content.html:
I removed the underlines.

@spaepcke Do you know what's hotkey is commonly used for Apply?

content.raw:
When I open the link inspector, add a new collision, select "mesh", and hit OK, Gazebo crashes with:

```
Error [Param.cc:146] Empty string used when setting a required parameter. Key[uri]
Qt has caught an exception thrown from an event handler. Throwing
exceptions from an event handler is not supported in Qt. You must
reimplement QApplication::notify() and catch all exceptions there.

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'Ogre::InvalidParametersException'
  what():  OGRE EXCEPTION(2:InvalidParametersException): Object index out of bounds. in SceneNode::getAttachedObject at /build/buildd/ogre-1.8-1.8.1+dfsg/OgreMain/src/OgreSceneNode.cpp (line 160)
```

content.raw: I don't understand this description. Does it mean that even though some fields are available in the message, if it's an update message then they should be ignored?
content.html: I don't understand this description. Does it mean that even though some fields are available in the message, if it's an update message then they should be ignored?

content.raw: fixed comment in 23dc62b. It means if `_update` is true then only update the widget with values from fields that are actually set in the message instead of getting the default values of every field
content.html: fixed comment in 23dc62b. It means if _update is true then only update the widget with values from fields that are actually set in the message instead of getting the default values of every field

content.html: Are materials supposed to work right now or is that planned for a later PR? (choosing materials from a script, that is)

content.raw:
It should be working. Note that purely color materials get somehow blended with the other color settings, so the result might not be as desired. 

But if you set to something like `Gazebo/Wood`, `Gazebo/Bricks`, it should show up in the preview and in the saved model.
content.html:
It should be working. Note that purely color materials get somehow blended with the other color settings, so the result might not be as desired.

But if you set to something like Gazebo/Wood, Gazebo/Bricks, it should show up in the preview and in the saved model.

content.raw: Got it! Those materials work for me. I was trying pure color materials like `Gazebo/Red` and `Gazebo/Blue`, but the link appeared grey.
content.html: Got it! Those materials work for me. I was trying pure color materials like Gazebo/Red and Gazebo/Blue, but the link appeared grey.

content.raw: A small UI thing: it's difficult or impossible to right click on a joint to get the Joint Inspector when two links are very close together or overlapping, since right clicking will only select the link inspector. The workaround for this is to pull the links apart and open the Joint Inspector, but maybe something can be changed so that the joint hotspot can still open the Joint Inspector.
content.html: A small UI thing: it's difficult or impossible to right click on a joint to get the Joint Inspector when two links are very close together or overlapping, since right clicking will only select the link inspector. The workaround for this is to pull the links apart and open the Joint Inspector, but maybe something can be changed so that the joint hotspot can still open the Joint Inspector.

content.raw: Another workaround is to zoom in all the way inside the link :D
content.html: Another workaround is to zoom in all the way inside the link :D

content.html: ya @spaepcke also commented on this, will think about how to best address this

content.raw:
I *think* we talked about this, but it may have been in a different context. Right-clicking on a link (or joint) could offer the Open Link Inspector option, as well as a Open Joint Inspector option for each joint that's connected to that link. That could potentially be many different Inspectors...We also talked about adding (to the Link Inspector) an option to open the Joint Inspector...

Do either of you remember what we decided?
content.html:
I think we talked about this, but it may have been in a different context. Right-clicking on a link (or joint) could offer the Open Link Inspector option, as well as a Open Joint Inspector option for each joint that's connected to that link. That could potentially be many different Inspectors...We also talked about adding (to the Link Inspector) an option to open the Joint Inspector...

Do either of you remember what we decided?

content.raw: We also talked about having a model tree on the palette kind of like the main window's model list widget where you can select links and joints, so that would be an alternative way of accessing inspectors.
content.html: We also talked about having a model tree on the palette kind of like the main window's model list widget where you can select links and joints, so that would be an alternative way of accessing inspectors.

content.html: Oh yes, that's true. Ian, correct me if I'm wrong, but I think we plan to integrate the model tree anyhow for M2, right?

content.html: ya that'll have to be done for M2

content.raw:
I might be trying too hard to get weird behaviours. So I tried this:

1) Insert a box

2) On the inspector, add a visual

3) Edit the new visual's pose to x = 1, roll = 1.57, apply

4) Select the part and scale it, the two visuals scale in different directions.

I know this is a very improbable situation, and fixing it will probably be very complicated because you'd probably have to check the orientation of each child, but I thought I should point it out anyway.
content.html:
I might be trying too hard to get weird behaviours. So I tried this:

1) Insert a box

2) On the inspector, add a visual

3) Edit the new visual's pose to x = 1, roll = 1.57, apply

4) Select the part and scale it, the two visuals scale in different directions.

I know this is a very improbable situation, and fixing it will probably be very complicated because you'd probably have to check the orientation of each child, but I thought I should point it out anyway.

content.raw: ok lets hold off on this until we're able to scale individual visuals properly
content.html: ok lets hold off on this until we're able to scale individual visuals properly

content.raw:
If I move a part using the translate and rotate tools while the inspector is open, the link's pose is updated in real time, which is really cool.

It would be great if the visual and collision scales also updated as they're being scaled. Currently this happens:

1) Insert a box, open the visual inspector - geometry shows as box with x == y == z == 1

2) Scale the box with the scaling tool, the box properly rescaled, but the inspector is not updated.

3) Press apply on the inspector, the box goes back to the unit size.

If you open the inspector after scaling, the updated value shows up though.
content.html:
If I move a part using the translate and rotate tools while the inspector is open, the link's pose is updated in real time, which is really cool.

It would be great if the visual and collision scales also updated as they're being scaled. Currently this happens:

1) Insert a box, open the visual inspector - geometry shows as box with x == y == z == 1

2) Scale the box with the scaling tool, the box properly rescaled, but the inspector is not updated.

3) Press apply on the inspector, the box goes back to the unit size.

If you open the inspector after scaling, the updated value shows up though.

content.raw: scale updates should be working now cfcc98c
content.html: scale updates should be working now cfcc98c
